action.action-desc: Ms. Stefanik introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and the Workforce

form.official-title: To amend the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act to ensure dislocated workers are provided consultation and advice for starting a small business as part the rapid response activities for dislocated workers.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Helping Individuals with Reemployment and Entrepreneurial Development Act or the HIRED Act.

section.header: Small business startup consultation and outreach for dislocated workers
section.text: Section 3(51) of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (29 U.S.C. 3102(51)) is amendedâ€”

paragraph.text: in subparagraph (B), by inserting , which may include training and activities related to entrepreneurship before the semicolon;
in subparagraph (E), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:

subparagraph.text: assistance to dislocated workers through increased outreach about small business opportunities and consultation about starting a small business.

section.header: Funding for small business consultation after a plant closing or mass layoff
section.text: Section 134(a)(2)(A) of such Act is amended by adding at the end the following:

clause.header: Permissible funding after a plant closure or mass layoff
clause.text: In the case of a permanent closure of or mass layoff at a plant, facility, or enterprise, or a natural or other disaster, that results in mass job dislocation, in order to assist dislocated workers in obtaining reemployment, a State may allocate up to 10 percent of the funds reserved under section 133(a)(2) to provide outreach about small business opportunities and consultation about starting a small business.
